FuncDef: The display logbuffer command displays logs in a log buffer.
CLIs: display logbuffer [ security ] [ slot <slot-id> | module <module-name> | starttime <starttime-value> [ endtime <endtime-value> ] | level { <severity> | <severityEnum> } | size <value> ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the log type as the security log.
-

Specifies the slot number of logs to be displayed.
The value is a string of 1 to 23 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies a module name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Displays logs recorded from the specified start time.
The value is in the format of YYYY/MM/DD,HH:MM:SS.
YYYY-MM-DD indicates the year/month/day. The value of YYYY ranges from 1970 to 9999; the value of MM ranges from 1 to 12; the value of DD ranges from 1 to 31.HH:MM:SS indicates the hour:minute:second. The value of HH ranges from 0 to 23; the value of MM and SS ranges from 0 to 59.

Displays logs recorded by the specified end time.
The value is in the format of YYYY/MM/DD,HH:MM:SS.
YYYY-MM-DD indicates the year/month/day. The value of YYYY ranges from 1970 to 9999; the value of MM ranges from 1 to 12; the value of DD ranges from 1 to 31.HH:MM:SS indicates the hour:minute:second. The value of HH ranges from 0 to 23; the value of MM and SS ranges from 0 to 59.

Displays logs based on severities.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.
0: emergencies: an error of urgency level1: alert: an error that needs to be corrected immediately2: critical: a major error3: error: a minor error4: warning: a potential error5: notification: information that should be noticed6: informational: an informational message7: debugging: a debugging message

Displays logs based severity.
0: emergencies: an error of urgency level1: alert: an error that needs to be corrected immediately2: critical: a major error3: error: a minor error4: warning: a potential error5: notification: information that should be noticed6: informational: an informational message7: debugging: a debugging message

Specifies the number of logs to be displayed.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10240.

Examples: Logging buffer configuration and contents : enabled

Apr 23 2020 09:37:53 R27 %%01ISIS/4/ISIS_LDP_SYNC_EVENT(l):CID=0x808604c5;Interface LoopBack0 received LDP event UndoInterfaceIpv4Family, LDP synchronization state Init change to Init(IsisSysInstance=17).
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To display logs in a log buffer, run the display logbuffer command.
The number of logs to be displayed using the display logbuffer command is determined by the number specified using the info-center logbuffer command. If the number of logs in the log buffer is less than that specified using value, all existing logs are displayed.
The display logbuffer command can display event logs and logs of other types. For information about event logs and logs of other types, see Log Reference. If a log is mapped to an "event trap OID", the log is an event log paired with an event trap. Event logs and the paired event traps have the same contents, and event logs can be queried based on the event trap OIDs.
Precautions
The log buffer records log messages of levels 0 through 4 by default. You can run the
info-center log-severity command to set the log severity as needed:
Set the severity of log messages to a value ranging 5 through 7 so that the log buffer does not record these log messages.Set the severity of log messages to a value ranging 0 through 4 so that the log buffer records these log messages.
If there are a large number of logs on the device, running the display logbuffer command to display logs based on the start time, end time, log severity, and number of logs to be displayed is recommended. Otherwise, the following problems may occur due to excessive logs:
The displayed information is repeatedly refreshed, causing desired information unable to be located.The system does not respond because of long-time information traversing and searching.
